##### TCGA-LIHC {#resultsDeseq2Vnn1HighVsLowProjectIdTcgaLihc}

For the whole TCGA-LIHC dataset, the differential expression analysis is done either considering only gender as covariate, or both gender and primary diagnosis.

###### Gender covariate {#resultsDeseq2Vnn1HighVsLowProjectIdTcgaLihcGenderCov}

```{r resultsDeseq2Vnn1HighVsLowProjectIdTcgaLihcGenderCovKnitPostDeseq2Template, cache=FALSE, results="asis"}
source("loadEnv.R")

smi <- "out/r/compute_deseq2/VNN1/HighVsLowProjectIdTcgaLihcGenderCov_ddss.rds"
linkSmiToRmdAndBookDir(smi)
ddss <- readRDS(smi)

smi <- "out/r/compute_deseq2/VNN1/HighVsLowProjectIdTcgaLihcGenderCov_ddssr.rds"
linkSmiToRmdAndBookDir(smi)
ddssr <- readRDS(smi)

knitPostDeseq2Template(
  d = ddss,
  r = ddssr
)
```
